Reviews.Title: “Excellent, central but quiet location for King's Cross Station”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in this Comfort Inn as the second part of a business trip in January 2012. As a country dweller who often travels to London on business, I am always keen to find a reasonably priced hotel that can offer me a quiet night's sleep. This establishment delivered. Upon arrival I was welcomed by Giovanni who was very professional and welcoming. I was offered a quiet room in the 'new block' which is accessed via a separate entrance a couple of doors down the same street. If you are looking for a quiet night, then the 'new block' is the insider tip! Further, as this section has only recently been opened, the rooms a fresh and very nicely decorated. The room I stayed in also benefitted from a pleasant and functional bathroom, with an excellent shower cubicle. Breakfast is served in the basement of the main building. The breakfast is a basic continental breakfast with cereals, toast and hard boiled eggs on offer - adequate to set one up for the morning, but nothing to get too excited about. Net Promoter Question: Would I recommend this establishment to my family and friends? Yes, quite likely!

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but convenient for Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: TheOriginalBaldie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen as it was convenient for the Eurostar. Comfort Hotel is okay for one night but I would not wish to stay there for longer. The room we had was clean and had recently been modernised including the bathroom. The shower cubicle looks nice but the shower itself lets it down badly with barely a trickle coming out. The breakfast area is very weary looking and needs to updated sooner rather than later. Breakfast was basic but acceptable. Hotels in London are generally very expensive (>£100) so when we saw this on Travel Republic at £95 we thought it was the best deal on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Eurostar & long distance Rail stations”
Reviews.Author: Christoph H
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very friendly and helpful receptionists; they look after your luggage after the check out...You can pick up your staff just before departure with Eurostar... The room is very clean and comfortable. The breakfast is excellent and the staff in the breakfast room are quick to serve you in a friendly manner. In summary the hotel is excellent for a short term stay ! Sincerely yours Chris Houben

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!!”
Reviews.Author: SHAGGYWOODY
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have every stayed in. We stayed here for one night in December 2011 before going to France on Eurostar and can honestly say it is a disgrace. We paid £100 for the night and I never slept a wink. Room opposite had tv on so loud we could hear every word. Room so small it was claustrophobic. Dirty carpets, bathroom and the beds were the cheapest mattresses I think a hotel could find. The pillows were dirty and flat. Absolutely awful and the breakfast was just as bad. I noticed at breakfast there were a lot of business men eating and felt sorry for them that their company had put them up in such a dive. But possibly cheapest for the area. Never, ever again. Would rather sleep on a park bench.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey and receptionist really pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: AleOxford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close to St PAncras and that's why I chose to stay here. The receptionist(a blond guy with the beard) was quite gentle and prepared the breakfast at 6 in the morning even if breakfast room open later 'cause we had an early check in for getting the train to Paris. The doors in hallway were difficult to leave open and squeeze through. The room was small but clean and for me was enough to be happy. The bathroom tidy, with clean towels. It will never be the best hotel in London but for 59 pound for a double room I don't think anybody can whinge or complain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: IAC1964
Reviews.Content: I have never felt compelled to write a review on here before but after reading some of the very unfair comments posted previously felt I needed to set the record straight. Firstly, as commented by several others, the accommodation is all being refurbished. We stayed in a "suite" which had undergone a refit - the two rooms were excellent - bright and clean with an excellent flat screen telly for entertainment. We also had a small kitchen area with a selection of plates and cutlery (although no cooking facility) if you wanted to eat in your room. The continental breakfast was as described - cold continental style buffet although a very helpful lady offered to make toast if required. All the staff were extremely helpful and polite. Not sure what kind of accommodation all the previous guests were expecting but for the price we paid, we were more than happy. Very convenient for St Pancras/Kings Cross - literally a 5 min walk. If all the rooms are done to the standard of ours, would definitely recommend for short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel, Terrible Service, Terrible Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Panayiotis S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in January of 2012. I have never written a hotel review before, but feel it's my duty to humanity to create a review for Comfort Inn Hotel in King's Cross. The hotel was generally very cramped, the passages where full of stairs which made getting to your room difficult. The rooms itself was horrible. I complained at the front desk 3 consecutive days before they moved me to a newly renovated room. This hotel has two types of rooms, the first type being old, full of mold, dirty, dusty and ridden with fleas. Honestly the most horrible place to stay. The second type of room they have a decent, worth a four star rating, but it's a gamble you'll have to take if you choose to stay there. The breakfast menu was "Boiled eggs and toast". Honestly!!! My colleague dared to try their boiled eggs, and spent the rest of his day with cramps! I couldn't bring myself to trying the eggs. Overall, it's a Terrible experience. Staff was unfriendly, and generally unhappy with the stay. The bad part of it all is that it was pre-paid by my company, hence, I couldn't move to another hotel. I was actually contemplating on paying for another hotel myself just to get out of there... I dealt with it by only going there to sleep, and leaving as early as possible. My advice to anyone, steer clear of this hotel. I certainly will...

Reviews.Title: “should have trusted reviews”
Reviews.Author: isdngirl
Reviews.Content: I am stuck in this dump for a week and when I say dump, never again will I ever stay at comfort inn. The room smells of damp to which the staff says they cant smell anything (as a smoker, if i can smell it, then theres a problem) The staff barely speaks english - obviously eastern block low paid employees, night staff the guy looks like a bouncer and is very unfriendly. No hot water so no showers, it better be fixed tonight - sorry but your 4 hour internet voucher doesnt cover no shower especially when the room looks to be about 100 years old. Mattress is beyond old - I haven't seen stripped like that since I visited my late grandma. Never again seriously. Dont trust this place at all - its horrid.

Reviews.Title: “The jekyll and hyde Hotel......... From Hell!!!”
Reviews.Author: JLavender
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked by an agent, not our client or our company who both have a rule that we stay at 4 star. And yes this hotel has a 4 star rating so we thought "standard 4 star London fare" An assumption we will never make again. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Kingscross rail station, across a busy road. Made from knocking 3-4 Victoria terraces together and then trying to squeeze in as many rooms as possible, this has the effect of creating a rabbit warren of corridors, strange angles, stairs and at least 6 fire doors before you get to your room. My room 123 and my colleagues room 122 could only be described as tiny squalid dumps, decor that looks like it has not been changed since 1978, the overpowering smell of dust won its fight with the sickening smell of dampness, the old worn out double bed, carpets and scruffy "Norman Bates" bathroom made my skin crawl, I slept in my clothes and used the shower once. Walls where so thin that the young lady next door who obviously was booking the room by the hour, kept me awake until the early hours with the same noises for each of her "friends" 10 out of 10 for consistency. Breakfast is served in the basement cafe style room, I say breakfast, let me explain, all it is is a croissant, toast and jam or the chefs special "a boild egg" needless to say we gave up after I ate one of the eggs and spent the rest of the day in the toilet. After 3 days of hell and daily complaints, they managed to find us some of the new rooms, they where clean, new, small but twice the size of the old rooms. It also explained how they got their 4 star status...... What a swindle. As most of my readers know I "say it as it is" shame on the people who gave them the 4 star rating and shame on the owners for renting out such squalid rooms on the back of a few good rooms. We live and we learn............. NO COMFORT AT THE COMFORT INN!

Reviews.Title: “Good value near main line stations & Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: MKMapman
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Kings Cross (St Chad's Street, as there's another nearby) is a useful place to spend the night if you have a later arrival or early departure from Kings Cross, Euston or St Pancras International (Eurostar). Like most of the relatively low cost hotels in the area it's made by knocking together a number of old houses, and so the rooms vary in size and shape. One slight criticism - the windows were single glazed, although the street itself is very quiet. For the price and location, it couldn't really be faulted - the bed was OK, the TV had Freeview (although a poor signal meant not all channels were available, and non-UK users might miss having any international programmes), there was tea/coffee equipment in room, the bathroom was fine and the continental breakfast was edible, with warm hard boiled eggs and rolls as well as toast. Only the fruit was below par as just tinned peaches! If you're there more than a night, it's worth knowing that there's a rack of "Boris bikes" (public cycle hire) on the street just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for city trip with very good location”
Reviews.Author: rudygvb24
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife for 2 days shopping in London during christmas. The hotel is very well situated at 5mn by feet from International train station St pancras and King's cross. Underground is at the same place, and very easy and useful to visit a city. The hotel is very good with a comfortable room, not big but enough space for us during one night. The price for one night in this class of hotel is very good, even the hotel is not big, the reception is helpful and the room is very clean and comfortable. A luggage room at disposal was also very appreciated for the returning day.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: escape_the_norm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what seemed to be the newly renovated part of the hotel, we had to exit and re-enter a seperate further down the street with our access cards. Room was an ok size , clean and modern. It had everything we needed and was very close to Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “No Need to have worried”
Reviews.Author: smiffyffield
Reviews.Content: After looking at the negative reviews, I was concerned. BUT i shouldn't have worried. The hotel is in the middle of renovations (dec 2011) probably in time for the olympic rush! The hotel room was decorated with the Burgandy wall / fittings. My room was freshly decorated, and the bathroom was very clean. Continental breakfast was a little disappointing, I was niavely hoping for Cooked! The "period windows" do let some of the outside noise in, but the road is not particularly busy, and it is set a bit off the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: Whoistheman
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Sunday, arrived late and what a surprise, 2 mins from st pan, excellent room, looked as though it was newly fitted. Night receptionist was very helpful (American guy, sorry if you are from Canada!). Will stay again, good rate. Small hotel but very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Cull
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Kings Cross for 1 night on a business trip. Having paid in excess of Â£130 I had assumed that this hotel would be a good standard. I found this hotel to be very basic and the rooms were poorly furnished. The breakfast is available but its not worth the extra money. I have a roll, rubbery croissant and a coffee. This is not a totally negative review as the cleanliness of the hotel could not be faulted and its location is great for the train network. If I had to stay near kings Cross again I would go for a novotel or Premier Inn as despite being basic the standard would be higher. For Business 1 night trips it's bearable, but if you are on a holiday I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A cardboard box at King's Cross offer's more comfort”
Reviews.Author: Geoff H
Reviews.Content: Never before have I written a review but I am so appalled, I feel it is my duty to do so now. Who on God's Earth gave this cess-pit a 4 star rating? They should be sued for mis-representation and Comfort Inn should hang their head in shame. I stayed at the Comfort Inn, King's Cross as it is close to the Eurostar terminal and I had an early train the following morning. I use a wheelchair and I pre-notified of my requirement. On arrival, the hotel is up 3 steps. Only shallow steps but the hotel does not even own a cheap ramp. My wife struggled and bumped me up the steps. Staff watched. Staff were polite but spoke poor English. They were apologetic and looked embarrassed - so they should be. My room was on the ground floor but the room entrance was sandwiched between two sets of firedoors so it took lots of lifting and manouvering to turn 90 degrees into the room. Well, I call it a room, it was a box. Possibly the smallest box I have ever stayed in. And as for the bathroom, I could not even get through the door. Being ground floor it was at pavement level. If the cheap and uncomfortable mattress was not enough to keep you awake, then the street light outside and the ability to hear every passer by was. And even if you managed to sleep through all that, then the filthy, flea-bitten carpet will give you nightmares. Unbelievably, I was made to complete a 2 page Health & Safety form as to what I wanted to happen in the case of fire. Made me feel like a piece of 3rd class meat. In any "normal" hotel, I would be evacuated along with other residents, not have to declare my personal details. Total and Utter waste of Â£130. Shame on you Comfort Inn for putting your name to this sardine tin. You may consider Â£130 cheap for London, but even people on low-incomes have standards - the following morning, even those card board boxes looked inviting outside of King's Cross compared to what we had just endured.

Reviews.Title: “Complete flee pit stay away for your own sake”
Reviews.Author: hazza_x
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at numerous hotels in my time, never before have felt so intrigued to write a review of a hotel. I checked into the comfort inn Kings Cross, for a single nights stay during the hot September period, for an evening out with friends in central London. The 2nd floor room overlooking the Kings Cross station end was very basic and small just enough space to swing a very small cat. The bed / mattress itself was old and squeaking metal framed bunk bed and generally very tired not comfortable in any sense. Bathroom was adequate at the price range and surprising cleaner than the room itself. After a night out and having returned to the hotel at approx midnight, having gone to the 2nd floor, I was shocked at what i saw whilst rummaging around all my pockets looking for the room key, a small field mouse running around in the corridor which then ran back and forth from within a linen cabinet and into and back out of another room, not sure if it was occupied by anyone. It seemed that the doors to all the rooms had gaps along the bottom of approx 2 inches from the ground letting in loads of light from the corridor and in the case of the Comfort Inn Kings Cross, mice too. Having been disgusted at this sight of the mouse, i went to complain to the night concierge about the uninvited guests; he advised he would let the manager know in the morning. Not getting any assistance from the chap at reception, I simply went back to the room, rolled up a towel and stuffed it under the door to stop the light and any mice making there way into my room and had an extremely unconformable nights sleep in what could only have been a flee infected bed. Would I ever book into the comfort inn again, simple answer NEVER Iâ€™d rather sleep of the station bench, Iâ€™m sure it would be cleaner and way more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “WOW is all I can say.”
Reviews.Author: Marianne B
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. It says it has a 4 star rating from some European company but if those people would have stayed in my room, they would have second guessed that choice. We didn't get our irst choice of hotels because it was half term for all the England schools, so many were filled, so we had to go with this one. Many Comfort Inn's in the states are fine so we thought the same would be for London as well. My back hurt SO bad after sleeping in one of the tiny old twin size beds they had in my room. They offer wifi but you have to pay for it. The location, like I said is the best part of this place. It's right near St. Pancres (My spellings off, I know) station and king's cross underground and train station. And the breakfast was poor. I've been all over Europe and this was the SADDEST breakfast I have ever seen. Cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice and toast. Terrible. The staff was nice and the front desk people were very helpful, but the rooms, ick.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Ugne A
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting a lot apart from clean and basic room. I was very surprised by the room i have stayed in. Very clean,very modern. I have stayed in couple Quality hotels and they wasnt as good as my stay in this hotel.I left as one happy customer.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: Bettenmar
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent one night here in two rooms on onward journey from Scotland to Paris and it is in a good position for the eurostar train in the morning. The room I shared with my young grandson was small and faced the street and there was a certain amount of noise throughout the night. My daughter and her husband got the room in the basement which was dingy and a bit damp and not a nice place for their young baby(cot was provided).The breakfast was continental self serve and the breakfast room in the basement was cramped and uncomfortable and the food was uninspiring. Glad it was a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: CraigW_64
Reviews.Content: I had the dubious pleasure of a two night stay in one of the suites. The first negative thing you notice in the corridors struggle to take a 6 ft tall person. Carrying a case is nigh on impossible. The 'suite' consists of a kitchen area, bathroom, lounge area and bedroom. The bathroom is very small and only had hot running water, I could not get the cold option to operate. The lounge had a fully made up sofa bed, odd option I was on my own. The 'lounge' had a tiny TV and a note on the free view box saying it worked, but the remote did not. As the box had no direct controls on it, this was useless. Generally the room was a bit shabby, obviously cleaned but not with any great time applied I suggest. If you do stay here, and I won't again, then do not pay for the breakfast option. The room is the most depressing place to start the day I've ever seen. The lady who serves is lovely but the box basement room does not start the day off well.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty looking sheets and worst possible room in the "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: extacy2508
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst "hotel" I ever stayed in. The sheets and carpet looked gross and dirty and we were given the room in the basement right beside the breakfast room and the lift which was so noisy we never had a good sleep. It doesn't help either that the floor boards were so thin that we could here guests coming in at night on the first floor. Ventilation in the room was bad and we did not dare open the windows as this wasn't the safest part of London.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty and nasty”
Reviews.Author: gretagretchen
Reviews.Content: Thank god I am only booked in for one night. If I wouldn't have prepaid I would have left the second I saw the room. I had just spent the weekend in a dated UK student hall and this was noticeably worse. Nice and close to the kings cross tube so it will be easy to get the heck out of here tomorrow morning. What a depressing way to end my UK holiday. four stars! What a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Sally_Loren
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by being positive: this hotel's location is very good. It's close to King's Cross, the trains and shops. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful at all times and have absolutely no complaints about them at all. Otherwise my own review echoes those of many others regarding this hotel. I am well aware that London hotel rooms are often smaller than in other parts of the country and more expensive. If I've understood it correctly, the star rating system is not based necessarily on appearance or ambience, but on whether the hotel has lifts/air con etc. Nev ertheless, when you read that the hotel is given a four-star rating, you expect a lot better, particularly as it's not a cheap place to stay. The overall look of the hotel is shabby - with many carpets in need of replacing. They DO have a lift, but the corridors are so narrow and there are still a few doors to negotiate that taking your suitcases to your room is something of an obstacle course (elderly people beware and get some help with them). Our room was VERY small and only OK for one night. Several nights in the room would have driven us nuts. The walls and ceilings are thin and you can CONSTANTLY hear people walking around at all times above you. And in a four-star hotel I do NOT expect to be woken up at 4 O'clock in the morning by the dulcet sounds of two people enjoying each other and the accompanying squeaky bed! The next morning we had to rise early and I was shattered. Breakfast was included. The breakfast is also not what we expected of a four-star hotel. You sit in a basement room with no window. Coffee was out of a machine and pretty tasteless - we took one sip and left the rest. The toast, jams and cheeses were not that great either. Considering there are so many good alternatives in the area we think they should get their act together here, or just not offer breakfast at all. We have just stayed in a tiny B&B in Edinburgh. Free WiFi was on offer and in many much smaller places we stayed too - so why not here? And when you are rated four star as well. So my overall verdict is very poor. We normally stay in the Premier Inn in King's Cross. The rooms are huge and if you book early a similar price, but it was a bank holiday weekend so had to take what was free. If the hotel was given a major overhaul then we might stay here again, but otherwise not.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn.....................Not!”
Reviews.Author: JanckieandIan
Reviews.Content: Hotel was chosen for location, that was the only good point. Staff appeared to be friendly while working in an establishment that needs some serious cash spent on it to even bring it up to basic standards.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiat25
Reviews.Content: staff did not know how to work they provided me with very dirty towel , bedding. I have to wait for 1.30 hour ( it was near midnight) until another staff came and give me the most basic thing- bedding and towel. I am very disappointed with this hotel and I would recommend you to stay away from this hotel. only location is good

Reviews.Title: “Decent but tiny rooms!”
Reviews.Author: eichenberg21
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel was affordable and clean. However, the rooms are tiny depending on how your room is laid out. Our first room had the foot of the bed facing the door so there was no room to put your luggage. We had our luggage at the foot of the bed and kept tripping on it every time we had to get to the bathroom from the opposite side of the bed or get outside our room. We stayed in the same hotel when we returned to London from Scotland later that week and were lucky enough to get a room with the foot of the bed facing the bathroom. This gave us a lot more space for our luggage and made the stay not as miserable. So, ask for a room with the foot of the bed facing the bathroom. Another tip is to ask for an ice bucket and the air conditioner remote when you first check in. The employees have the habit of not telling you this and you will have to make a second trip to the front desk. Otherwise, the free breakfast was decent and the hotel was in a decent location near the St. Pancras Station. If you need free wifi, there is a pub down the street called The Euston Flyer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to the Eurostar station”
Reviews.Author: JanStenberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was going with the Eurostar to Paris in the early morning and for that this hotel is perfect, just a few minutes away from the station. The hotel is OK, the room was a bit larger than I'm used to in London. Clean, quiet at night. It's a bit away from the city centre for me, but the tube is close by and it's only a few stations to e.g. Tottenham Court Road. Overall good value for the money. The wireless Internet access is to expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Very old and tired.”
Reviews.Author: digimom98
Reviews.Content: Location very good for St. Pancras Station. Hotel very old and very tired and worn. Staff friendly and helpful. Breakfast good. I did not feel safe when we checked in at night. But the next morning I did notice a lot of families at breakfast, so that made me feel better. Rooms very small. Needed a special remote to get the a/c to work but they did not tell us that upon check-in, so we had to go back to the front desk and get one. Still, could not get the a/c to work in one of our rooms. Water just dribbled out of faucet for shower. Upon check-in, some R rated movie was playing on the big screen in the lobby and my family and I were greeted by images of a naked woman on the TV. Not a good first impression.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortless Inn”
Reviews.Author: archaeopat99
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights over two visits to this inn and must say it was among the worst places I have encountered in my many years of travel. The first room was very small, hot and uncomfortable, and the second room was worse. The staff did the best they could, but they simply do not have much to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible, horrible”
Reviews.Author: Kram3
Reviews.Content: Was booked into this hotel for an overnight business stay. It was truly awful. My room - 120 - was dingy, shabby and depressing, with bedding that may qualify for antique status as it was left over from the 80's. So washed out that it was impossible for it to smell clean any more. The pillows and duvet were wafer thin. But the noise...... my room was directly below a corridor, I think, because there was constant extremely loud marching until 1am and starting again at 4.30am. A shower overhead was in constant use - it really sounded like someone was in my bathroom and that there was a small army on drill in my room. There is clearly no insulation or soundproofing. The 'breakfast' was lierally inedible - croissants like rubber and tea that remained a pale grey colour no matter how long you left the tea bag in. This was all served in a cramped corridor area in the basement. I really cannot warn anyone off this hotel strongly enough. The cost for the above was Â£130 - ridiculous. I was unable to complain upon check out as the receptionist was on the phone the entire duration while dealing with my payment. She appeared surpirsed when I asked for the contact details of the manager - I cannot imagine why. I await a response to my written complaint, but I will never ever stay there again. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated for Euston & St Pancras”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolElaineS
Reviews.Content: Good basic style hotel . I was on a mini break with a friend. The room was comfortable and had air-conditioning and tea making facilities. Good shower in bathroom. Breakfast was continental style but sufficient for our needs. Staff very helpful. The added bonus was that we could leave our luggage at the hotel after checking out. This meant we could spend the day sight seeing without having to cart our bags around and as the hotel so was near to Euston station it was very convenient to call in to pick up bags en route to station.

Reviews.Title: “Functional. Nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Decca88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is handily located near Kings Cross/St. Pancras stations. I guess because of the Comfort Inn branding, it seems a safer bet than some of the independent budget hotels nearby. Single rooms are small, but adequate for a one night stay. Bathroom is fine: clean and decent shower pressure. The bed in my room wasn't very comfortable: cheap, sagging mattress and two pillows with the thickness of folded tea towels. I didn't sleep that well and my back hurt the next morning. However, the room itself was quiet. Breakfast was included and was perfectly adequate - the usual continental self-service spread. Plenty of staff on hand to stock things up, tidy away etc. A very pleasant woman of (I think) Filipina origin seems to manage the breakfast room. Given that she is running a breakfast room in a busy budget hotel, the high level of care, attention and warmth she demonstrates in interacting with guests is quite astonishing. If the hotel management reads this, then please take note - I hope you value that woman and reward her accordingly. People like her are like gold dust in the hospitality sector - especially in London! In fact, staff seem to be the real strength of this place (at least it seemed so in my brief visit). Front desk staff were welcoming, responsive and accommodating. Value for money? Well, it is London. However, Â£105.00 a night should get you a firm mattress and proper pillows, surely!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and miserable”
Reviews.Author: speedyjoe
Reviews.Content: We were 'upgraded' to a family room which consisted of a musty smelling room, two beds one of which was a very thin foam mattress on wooden slats. The bathroom was very shabby, the pillows like rocks and the hairdryer only emitted cold air. I had no interest in sampling the breakfast so can't comment on that. I couldn't wait to leave. The staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: PeterBean
Reviews.Content: Basic, budget, no frills. All could be used to summarise this hotel. It did the job for what we wanted. A base for our stay in London. We had a room for 4 people which cost in the region of Â£120. Not bad value for London. The hotel ticked the boxes of what was needed. Something central and cheap. For 'youth hostel money' you could do a whole lot worse. The location is good, a few minutes walk from Kings Cross although this area is a bit shady late at night. If you are looking for a central London hotel on a budget, consider here. Again, I stress this place is basic although it is clean and warm which is most important. For budget travellers, groups on a night out or last minute bookings this place is recommended although for a romantic weekend, probably look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: RunningCanuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really dingy, the beds uncomfortable and the walls thin. The only plus was proximity to Eustuon and St. Pancreas train stations. Way overpriced for a 2 star quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B with good location for Station”
Reviews.Author: Shuttie
Reviews.Content: I wanted a simple night stay before catching an early train the following morning, so didnt not sample breakfast, I just wanted the room, and a short walk in the morning. My single room was small, but clean. The lift wasn't working so I got free internet access. Location for station is ideal. Price I paid was ok for a 2-3 star in London, so recommend they downgrade, then they will get much better reviews. This is not a 4 Star

Reviews.Title: “Four star rating for this hotel is a joke. Two stars at best.”
Reviews.Author: VT2011
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Expedia, who advertised this as a four-star property. Paid $178 per night (including breakfast and taxes) for a single room . When I saw my room (302) I felt like I was completely ripped off. Four stars for this hotel is an absolute joke, the room I had is worse than I got in many backpacker accommodations in my youth. Absolutely no comparison with the Holiday Inn Bloomsbury which is nearby and is also rated four star . Kings Cross Comfort Inn does have pleasant, polite and helpful staff -- I'd say they are four star. But for the rest of the hotel - no way.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, very bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: charmingmal
Reviews.Content: Booked this B&B through their site, though looked up reviews on different other sites where they advertise. Comfort Inn is advertised everywhere as a Hotel, in reality it is a 2 star B&B. Price on their site was Â£85, if you book it on the phone - Â£105. I was also fooled by their advertising, and arrived to this shabby looking street near the train station, thnking, that it does not look right for the location of a 4 star hotel. Reception had no help with luggage, though I requested it. Horror started when I got to the 3 floor - smell of mould hit my nose, threadbare carpets on stairs, very narrow staircase, a real fire hazard. When I looked at my room, I knew it was a big mistake to come here, but at midnight it was too late to search for anything else. Prison cell in`Porridge` looks better than this awful, cramped, dirty room with horribly noisy shower which did not work properly. Even bed was dirty - had a huge brown stain on the base. Pillow like a brick, made it impossible to sleep. When I complained to the receptionist in the morning, he was extremely rude, and shouted, that it was ALL MY FAULT! That I should ask reception for another room, if I did not like this one. First, where is the guarantee, that all their rooms are not like mine was, and at one o`clock in the morning I was so tired and upset, that I could not face moving - remembering their stircase! Breakfast was very poor quality, small choice, for the money I payed. It was a rip-off and will recommend to every one to STAY AWAY from this awful place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DmitryP4
Reviews.Content: Standart Comfort Inn hotel. Nice room, clean. Standard regular breakfast. Way to expensive (~$160)

Reviews.Title: “Great location at good price”
Reviews.Author: KGM26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend of shopping and sociaising in London. Had all the basics you need, strong hot shower, flat screen TV with basic channels, comfy beds, tea/coffee facilities, iron and ironing board on request, good enough hair dryer. Major complaint would be the temperature of the room!! Soooooo cold. Turned the 2 radiators on as soon as we got there and did not turn them off all weekend, but the room just did not warm up! Definetly needs more insulation! Also, smell of damp in hallway, and lots of doors and stairs to negotiate, not an issue for us but could be for some people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good value”
Reviews.Author: TR_Abroad
Reviews.Content: Located just around the corner from St Pancras International Train Station we only stayed here one night as we were leaving on the Eurostar early the next morning. The hotel is less than ten minutes walk away but still in a quite location. The room was very good, being one of the few family rooms we have stayed in that actually had proper beds for all and not sofa beds. Breakfast on a Sunday was advertised as starting at 0730 but as we needed to be at the station by about 0800 we went down a little earlier which was fine. The lady setting up breakfast has got to be one of the friendliest hotel staff I have come across in London. Overall good value for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: clivesevilc
Reviews.Content: Impeccably clean and well presented, if you're after a small but totally functional room with en-suite and tea/coffee facilites - for very cheap rates, 3 minute walk from St Pancras and King's Cross - then this is you. Reception is a standout, afable and helpful - a delight. Rooms are small, with a bit of a labyrinth to get to some. Noice could be an issue. But on the whole, a pleasuralbe stay. And check out Casa Mama's just around the corner - cheap and cheerful Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Not good even if chip”
Reviews.Author: TallyfromNYC
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on proximity to Euston Train Station, which is a 10 minute walk. I did not realize that the neighborhood is not that great near Euston and Kings Cross train stations. When I returned after a day of sightseeing late at night, I did not feel very comfortable with quite a lot of "street workers" around. Overall, the hotel is "cheap" and I would say 2 and not 4 stars. There were three good sides: 1) the reception stuff was very professional and accommodating; 2) the rooms were clean; 3) the bathrooms were large. On a downside, the hotel deco was shabby, the mattresses were awful, we did not get a wake up call missing important plans. Overall, the only major draw of staying here is the price. We stayed in another hotel in London later in the week, which ended up costing twice as much as this one and was only marginally better. So, given London prices, this may be all you can get for the buck (but I would search further before making that decision).

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: machar
Reviews.Content: Everything in this hotel seemed to make life difficult. Check in was fine and the girl was polite and courteous but getting out of reception to the corridor was a big struggle with my case, laptop bag and poster tube thanks to 2 huge heavy doors that you have to go through. I managed to struggle through one only to find myself in a tiny space and having to struggle through yet another door! Up stairs and down stairs and round corners with all my luggage and I eventually got to my room. The decor and bedding was old. It looked faded and was ridiculously old fashioned. I'm not tall at 5ft 2 and I could almost touch the ceiling when I stood on tip toe. There were no plug points apart from at the desk which I found awkward (why can't they have at least one in the direction of the bed?) and even with just me in the room, space was tight esp in the tiny bathroom! I slept okay as my room was at the back of the hotel but it went dowhill in the morning when there was no hot water in the entire place so no shower for me. A continental breakfast was included but I took one look at the rammed tiny breakfast room and decided to eat out instead. I couldn't even see a free seat nevermind a table! Word of warning - if you want a lie in don't accept a room in the basement next to the breakfast room as you'll have most of the hotel trudging past your room. The location is excellent but it definitely was not worth the Â£104 that thankfully I didn't pay as I was travelling on business!

Reviews.Title: “A swing and a miss...”
Reviews.Author: tomrob83
Reviews.Content: We booked our one-night stay at the Comfort Inn Kings Cross for our short stay in London. Our sceptisism rised as we entered the hotel when an odeur of "old" hit us. Then, checking in, the receptionist demanded Â£40 as a deposit and told us where to stay. We were six friends sharing two rooms. One in the first floor wich was not good at all, smelly, small and uncomftable beds. But, when myself and my other two friends were checking in, we were told that our rooms was located in the hotel basement. An awfull "room" with poor standard both bedwise and bathroom condition! Not to recommend at all, sorry... The only reason this hotell is not given only ONE star, is its location at Kings Cross witch os quite good!! Cheers!!

Reviews.Title: “"Comfort Inn" is slightly misleading”
Reviews.Author: bobdibest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Comfort Inn for one night prior to catching the first train to Paris from St Pancras the following day. I needed a budget hotel near the station. I am used to budget hotels, Travelodge, Premier Travel Inn etc, but this is far from those!! I didn't realise that hotels still had single rooms, let alone single rooms smaller than what I'd call a box room. My single room had a small single bed, just about enough space to turn around in and a tiny bathroom. I don't expect much from a budget hotel, but I have stayed in enough Travelodge's to know what sort of size is acceptable for the room price - no matter how central in London the hotel may be. All this would be just about manageable if the hotel spent some money on its decor, which is quite frankly dated and in need of replacing. This was an old fashioned and tiny hotel room which didn't feel too far off those rented by the hour - especially in Kings Cross! I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, New Fixtures!”
Reviews.Author: papermoon4
Reviews.Content: Finally, a London budget hotel with enough room to swing a cat in! Alright, a small cat - a kitten. But the double room we booked was roomy and the bathroom was spacious enough for two! The entire hotel has been re-fitted with new fixtures, including a small flatscreen TV, lighting, bedding, shower, and basin. Very clean and a very friendly, out-going staff to help. Breakfast is the best of 'continental' with fresh hot toast and hard-cooked eggs to ease the pain of not getting the 'full English'. One block in from the main drag(s) so not noisy at all. And most important - very close to Kings Cross Station for convenient travel in, out and around London!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clearn, quiet, pricey”
Reviews.Author: rye1967
Reviews.Content: Hotel was within walking distance of Kings Cross Railway Station. The lady running the breakfast area was very friendly and pleasant. My room on the top floor was quiet, but small with just a single bed against the wall and seemed more like the kind of room I would get in a family run b&b rather than an international chain charging 100 gbp per night. The room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Corridors opressively narrow. General lack of space in the building. I would prefer to pay more for more space.

Reviews.Title: “Only 3 min walk from Kings Cross my room...”
Reviews.Author: UKandbeyond
Reviews.Content: Only 3 min walk from Kings Cross my room was a lot quieter than others I've stayed in around this area. For an overnight stay it's perfect, though you might want to find somewhere else to have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modest rooms, cooperative personnell”
Reviews.Author: PomiKalnar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel more than a dozen times during the last few years. Its location is very convenient for me (St. Pancras station, Thameslink) as my business meetings are held just 20 walking minutes away. The rooms are very small and modest, but if you spend most of your days outside the hotel itself, this is not a big issue. A couple of times when my travel plans had to be changed for various reasons, the hotel was quite cooperative in solving my problems. Also, if you like to explore London on foot, it will take you only about 35 minutes to Covent Garden. In sum, I would specifically recommend this hotel to people looking for a well connected base to stay the night, have a shower, log in to their internet account (not free), treat themselves to a modest breakfast in the basement room - and leave for business or pleasure for rest of the day. For people with this kind of priorities it value for money is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Umm...p'raps not”
Reviews.Author: ParisMetro
Reviews.Content: Hotel in an ideal location to take an early morning Eurostar from St Pancras to Lille. But that's about it. Exterior of the building promises some hope which is quickly dispelled once you're inside and in reception. Tired Seventies would best describe the decor, but fine if you like orange. Designed by someone with a passion for doors as you may lose count how many you go through before reaching your room. Darkish corridors with low energy lighting might win prizes for the Climate Changing Brigade but won't inspire a welcome in the hillsides. If that doesn't put you off the rooms certainly will (unless, of course, you don't mind paper thin walls and late night revellers trolling around in the rooms above and below you. Wow, we didn't think hotels like this still existed in the capital, but to be absolutely fair, the beds were clean and the telly worked. Breakfast was, how shall we say, not bountiful? Edible, yes - but satisfying, well, we've had worse (but not often). To summarise, it's handy for the stations - but so is Age Concern which is on the same street. Put the kettle on Ma, we're on our way back home...

Reviews.Title: “DARK AND CLAUSTROPHOBIC ROOM”
Reviews.Author: ClimateGeorge
Reviews.Content: OK, I know this is supposed to be the budget end, but this was really unpleasant. The window in my room (111) had been glued shut so there was no fresh air. it has an air conditioner but all that does is cool the stale air and push it round. There was no way to turn off the bathroom fan without taking my door card out of the slot (ie turning off all the lights) and the tv reception was so bad that it was unwatchable. The breakfast coffee was pretty foul and the roll came with some kind of wierd industrial 'meat'.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Train Station”
Reviews.Author: PadparadschaBE
Reviews.Content: The comfort inn is low budget, low frills, but right beside the Kings Cross / St. Pancreas train station. Don't expect anything fancy - the main attraction of this hotel is its very convenient location, no more than a couple of minutes walk from the train station. The rooms are small and not terribly comfortable, and the TV in my room didn't work when I stayed there, but a stay here allowed me to catch an early train without having to stress about getting to the station in the morning, which is worth something. The staff are helpful, and the place is clean, if a little bit shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting...”
Reviews.Author: Selim-imre
Reviews.Content: Altough I'm a hotelier since 1990, for the first time I made a mistake and stayed such a bad kind of hotel in London. Actually my aim was to stay a bit near to the Business Design Center, which my seminer was there.. The room was so so so much smaller that Ä±'ve never seen more smaller rooms in my life and even if you would like a water, the receptionist tells you to go to the market !!! Besides these, I found several insects in my bed and couldnt sleep the whole night.. I strangly do not recommend this kind of hotel groups to anyone.. Regards,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful in every way! Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller121
Reviews.Content: The best advice I could give you is book a different hotel. I returned to my room after a wonderful day out with friends to find that my room door has been left open by a staff member at the hotel and on going to report this to reception and asking to speak to a Manager I was told this was not possible as it wasn't necessary!! My personal belongings were in the room and I can't be sure that nothing has gone missing/been stolen. I have been told they will review cctv if i want them to and see which staff member it was. I don't care for which staff member it was - I am appauled that they think this is ok as nothing appears to have been taken. I spent all night thinking about who had been in our room and what for. Especially as we were told it definately wasn't the cleaner as they hadn't been there in the afternoon which poses the question of why would anyone else need to enter my room?? The location is perfect for the train but that is the only positive I can give this hotel. Staff were rude and did not care and service was not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was sooooooo nice :)”
Reviews.Author: marie_kallstrand
Reviews.Content: I can recomend this hotel okay maybe it ain`t a 4 star hotel but the rooms were nice, clean. We had no trouble with the warm water and we stayd for 3 days And the breakfast was nice and good:)) WE HAD A GREAT TIME AT THIS HOTEL:))

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: Alan062
Reviews.Content: I picked this Hotel as it was described as a 4 star Hotel on another site as well as a sign on the front of the Hotel. This is NOT a 4 star Hotel; far from it. I would rate it 1 star, just to be generous. I was only saying the one night, so I didn't do my usually research, but I thought it was close to my destination and it was a comfort Inn (where I have stayed before) and was very happy. This is NOT a typical Comfort Inn. When I arrived I was told I received an upgrade form the reservation I placed; I can't imagine what the room would be without the upgrade. The room had no draws to put our clothes, air conditioner and TV did not work, even after two failed attempts to fix. Even the smallest thing about using the safe; did not work unable to fix as well. The view was of another wall of the hotel. Again, just staying the one night, I didn't want to waste a lot of time getting the items fixed taking time away from seeing London, so I just lived with the problems. I guess the worst of all was when I filled out a requested comment from the Hotel and expressed all the concerns above as well as an e-mail directly to the Hotel; NO RESPONSE.

Reviews.Title: “warning on booking this hotel by phone”
Reviews.Author: petersonmj
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and thought it was alright. Nothing special, but quite decent family rooms for the price. However, when we arrived on Saturday having booked directly with the hotel about 2 months previously, they claimed to have no record of our booking and were completely unhelpful. Fortunately we walked across the road to the Premier Inn and were able to book a room there instead, I would have doubted by own memory of having made the booking at Comfort Inn except that my wife happened to be in the room when I rang them and clearly remembers me asking them to double check the dates and the details. Shockingly bad service. Do not trust a booking with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie2075
Reviews.Content: It was a renovated old building just down the street from the train station at Kings Cross. Only had a shower because it was small, but was clean and cozy

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN”
Reviews.Author: chrisallan
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ludicrously small even by European standards. There was a tiny closet and no chest of drawers to put clothes in. The bed was too short and was lumpy and uncomfortable. There was a small desk but it was so close to the end of the bed that you couldnt sit down at the chair provided. The furniture looked like it had been made in a high school carpentry class. There was nowhere but the floor to put your suitcase on. The breakfast was served in the basement - very cramped with low ceiling - hard boiled eggs, toast, packets of cheese, etc. Appalling coffee. The staff in the breakfast room was friendly and helpful. The staff on the desk didn't have a record that one of our party was staying at the hotel so he didn't get an important message re business. The keys to our rooms only worked occasionally and we were constantly going down to the reception desk to get replacements. The central location does not make up for the cell-like rooms and incompetent front desk staff. I wouldn't even think of staying in the hotel again and will tell friends to avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Pitiful”
Reviews.Author: jimbo061
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune of staying in. It deserves zero stars! Booked through Expedia who should be ashamed to have this on their list of places to stay in London. The room for two was miniscule, no drawers for clothes, cold water almost every day, and a front desk staff that could have cared less. We had booked for 8 nights through Expedia and would have left but for the fact that payment was non-refundable. A clever ruse, and one I blame Expedia for. A dreadful experience, never to be repeated - neither the hotel, nor Expedia!

Reviews.Title: “I would surely NOT recommend this hotel to anybody.”
Reviews.Author: AnnSimoens
Reviews.Content: I would surely NOT recommend this hotel to anybody. I stayed there on hotel points (rewards) with my parents. I called the hotel beforehand to know if there was going to be a surcharge for a 3rd adult in the room and they said there wouldnâ€™t. When I checked in, they said there was going to be a surcharge (and the amount was quite high â€“ I am sure I could have found a different hotel for the 3 of us, only for the price of the surcharge of this one â€“ but I did not have a choice as they only advised me when we checked-in). Even if I had written down the name of the person with whom I called and the date and time, they said it was just a mistake and that they could not have said that there was not going to be any surcharge. So we agreed on paying the price (cause we didnâ€™t have a choice in fact.) Then we could not enter our room around noon yet so we wanted to leave the luggage into the locker room. That one was so small that our luggage could not be kept in there anymore. So we had to leave them at the reception desk. When we finally got to enter our room, we discovered it was really old and there was mildew on the windows. The heating was very old so it lasted long until the room was heated up. The bathroom did not have decent towel racks, nor soaps. Only 2 containers without any labels so we would just have to guess which one was the shampoo and which one was the regular soap. There was hardly water running out of the shower. There were no shower caps (so too bad if you had forgotten to bring your own) and the water was not hot at all. On our last day, we had to check out using the small and slanting stairs because the (tiny) elevator did not work. This way, my mom hurt her knee severely. Overall, this hotel was an awful experience to me. It was the worst hotel I had ever stayed in when being in London (and it was my 8th time so I can say I have quite a bit experience.) One positive thing though, the breakfast was quite ok and there is a very friendly lady serving it.

Reviews.Title: “strange hotel, interesting experience”
Reviews.Author: OhioBengalfan
Reviews.Content: This was an odd hotel. We got it on an award stay and we got fantastic value for the points needed, just 8K points if I recall. For a place on London that's great. But it was a strange hotel. You go though multiple doors to get to the rooms like 1 after another. Its quite hard and annoying if you have luggage. The rooms are all scattered around and hard to find as well. It's hard to describe. It was clean though and the breakfast was good and it was not too far a walk to kings cross station. The room was very small even by European standards. Was also noisy too or at least potentially so. When we were there I do not think they were fully booked, if they had been noise could have been a problem. It's hard to decide what to give this hotel. Torn between 2 and 3 stars. I think there are a lot better places out there, but overall we were happy enough with the stay. We got great value, it was clean and safe, and we got a morning meal. So I guess I will give it 3. But honestly I would not stay again or recommend it to anyone unless they had some points and were going to stay on an award or unless they got an amazing deal. Honestly there are travelodge's out there that are much better and sometimes on sale for 19 or 29 pounds if you catch the promos. Nothing special about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: pparis30
Reviews.Content: Stay away unless you want to be bitten by bed bugs and not have any hot water for two days and have a bed where the springs are almost poking out of the mattress and where you have to queue up for breakfast because there aren't enough tables or food.

Reviews.Title: “Open letter to Choice Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Harold34
Reviews.Content: My check in date and my check out date were the same day. This is one of the worst hotels I have ever encountered in my 40 years of travelling. The hotel reeked of old and mould, the room which we were offered was up 5 flights of stairs with no elevator, the next room we were offered was in the basement. The halls are so narrow that getting oneself and ones suitcase down the hall was a chore. We had 2 rooms ordered, one for my wife and myself and one for our 2 boys. When I informed the hotel that their sign represented the hotel as a four star and that the rooms were totally unacceptable we were informed we would be charged for 2 rooms for one night whether we stayed or not. The rooms were so bad we left and found other accomodations. I have informed my credit card company to reverse the charge on the room as the advertising for this hotel borders on fraud. I sent an email to Choice Hotels and am awaiting their response.

Reviews.Title: “Small, petite and bijous”
Reviews.Author: bearskinBirmingham
Reviews.Content: This hotle is an ideal location to stay if you are travelling on Eurostar but be warned the rooms are small. Don't expect to be able to swing anything bigger than a kitten as there isn't room. Breakfast seemed to be a little chaotic and again the breakfast room was quite small and situated in the basement. Reception staff could be friendlier when checking out and ask if everything was ok with the stay and hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “would recommend”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghHootsmon
Reviews.Content: I am usually the first to complain about hotels but I have to say we found no problems with this hotel and if there was I would not have missed them. On arrival the reception staff were very nice and helpfull, the room although small was very clean and bathroom was ok in size.In the morning the breakfast staff were very helpfull and pleasant. In summary the hotel was in a perfect location for Kings cross and the tourist attractions,the hotel was clean and staff pleasant .so for a short stay I am happy that I booked this hotel and will return

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel, but... not exactly bad.”
Reviews.Author: DJSON80
Reviews.Content: So this was at the bottom of our hotels, but that doesn't mean we it was necessarily bad... We stayed at an older 4 star in London and a Swiss hotel in Amsterdam, so this was again the "worst", but it was clean, semi-quiet, and close to the Eurostar/Tube, which is why we picked it. Problems... The shower is terrible! Weak pressure, small as hell, and the water says it's not portable, which is weird for London?!?! The room was tiny and didn't have tissue, an iron, and again the water was not drinkable, so the coffee and tea they provide required you to buy bottled water. We left the room once with the do not disturb sign on the door and noticed when we returned the window was open?!?! Not cool as we remember closing it and locking it... The breakfast was great though and started the day off right!

Reviews.Title: “Run as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: cwboy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was close to the Kings cross Station which is from where we were taking the train to Paris. It rates itself as a 4 star hotel but with 30 stairs to our room which reeked and the door which hit the bed it was the worst hotel we have been in in the last 30 years of our travelling. When we saw the rooms and the stairs we needed to climb we told them this was unacceptable and they offered us a room in the basement. In the end we went to the Novotel around the corner for 15 pounds more. Place is a sh**hole and the tourist bureau and the health department need to take a serious look as it is a heath hazard and should be delisted as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average rating for an average hotel - overall, it worked for us”
Reviews.Author: bjreimann
Reviews.Content: Great location (especially for the Eurostar). We had the suite and it worked really well for us - plenty of room for my husband and I and our 2 teenage sons. Nice view - air conditioner worked well. We had a couple of issues - the electricity didn't work (which meant our shower didn't work and we had just arrived after a long plane trip from the States) - the repair person wasn't able to come immediately and, being that we were only going to be in London for a couple of days, we didn't want to waste time waiting for showers. We ended up having to take them in my brother's room and parent's room. Overall, the hotel worked fine for our needs and was in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel i stayed while I was in Britain”
Reviews.Author: marcRioDeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: I spent about 16 days in Britain and this was the worst hotel I stayed in. Furthermore, it was the most expensive hotel I stayed in the whole trip (and I found a better hotel in London after two days and cleaner and cheaper). My room was in the basement, very dark and the appearance was the worst. I would never recommend this to anyone, unless the other rooms (not in the basement) are better. The staff was ok. The sheets and bed linen were not clean. I had no option but to stay in this hotel because I had arrived from Newcastle on a Friday afternoon. I wanted to stay in the King's Cross area, so I opted for this. When I go back to London I will definitely book another hotel so that I don't have to stay in this again. Never. The only positive aspect is its locality. Other than that, too expensive and too sombre and my room in the basement was very depressing.

Reviews.Title: “After a short break in a delightful hotel abroad, I was appalled at what I found here.”
Reviews.Author: ricjam
Reviews.Content: Entrance was uninviting. Two youths who sprawled across the settee did not seem to be guests and stared at me as I walked in. Receptionist was pleasant and helpful. Passageway to my room was very narrow and awkward to navigate. My room was fairly cramped - a double room with twin beds. Bed bases were uncovered, exposing the base material - no valances. Top covers were grubby looking although sheets were okay. After settling into bed, I discovered several long hairs under the top sheet. I handed these to the receptionist the following morning. The 'computer desk' advertised was a very small table covered by the kettle and tea/coffee sachets. The kettle was faulty and had to be held in place in order to make contact with the mains connection. The carpet was dirty although it had been vacuumed. The tv signal was very poor and after flickering on all channels for some time, it finally gave up the ghost and the signal failed completely. Bathroom was just about alright although the toilet roll holder was of poor construction and allowed the toilet roll to drop out when touched. The shower cubicle was dirty/rusty around the edges and there was uncleaned gel on the floor. The room overlooked the street which was noisy most of the night. There was only single glazing and the frames were badly in need of a lick of paint. I did not choose to partake of breakfast as I had no desire to stay longer than necessary. Receptionist at departure agin very pleasant. Having stayed in a Barcelona hotel which charged far less and was vastly superior in all aspects, I felt ashamed at the dreadful overall standard back in England.

Reviews.Title: “"Comfort" - The Irony !”
Reviews.Author: jodola
Reviews.Content: Not the worst I've stayed in but.....Tiny TV in top corner of room, no remote, Aircon with no controls (Better than no aircon at all), grubby linen, mattress definitely past its acceptable date, cups stuck to cabinet, tap water not drinkable but not bottles in room either, 1 hand towel, shower with mildew smell and had two settings, cold or scalding hot. Noisy corridor, thin walls between rooms. I stay away a lot and I don't whinge but this is one to avoid. Premier Inn or Holiday Inn if you can around here, at least you know what your getting.

Reviews.Title: “No comfort”
Reviews.Author: mely93
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Comfort Inn once in my life 2 years a go when i was 14 and i would assure anyone that i would never ever come back there! Firstly the reception was OK but the only thing that disturbed me were the two recepitionists people who were constantly annoyed and unavailable to us and other guests. Secondly me and my family had booked a room on the 1st floor not knowing there were suites available. Thirdly the lifts were very small and claustrophobic meaning that more than 3 people it could not hold so most of the time we had to squash to make room for other people. And by the way it was very slow! The hallway taking us to our room was very narrow and it was impossible to walk through if you had a big luggage. To open the room the electric cards needed did not work most of the time and it would take hours to enter. Once we asked if they had spare keys and they actually said that they had lost them! And now for the Grand finale Our "room" that could not be called a normal room considering it was at the basement floor, with two double beds stuffed in, dirty duvets full of dust and a minuscule wardrobe where there was no space to hang your clothes! The bathroom, and now, this is the most shocking bit.. it had a big step at the front where you had to be careful not to trip into, towels were not changed so we were forced to use the same towels for 3 days, the sink was very low and uncomfortable, the shower was put at an angle of the bathroom meaning it was very narrow and you actually could not move in it, it always leaked even when you closed the water so it was desperate in need of repair and the temperature handle would NOT work so you would waste half of your time fiddling with it hoping hot water would come out but nothing! So we were forced to freeze to death. The windows were the most negative part of all, they did not open meaning your room would not be aired and so remained stuffy and hot also because the air conditioning did not work nicely and made a squeaky sound, the view considering we were at the basement was TERRIBLE you could see people walking by and they could see you which implies there were no curtains to hide yourself from for a bit of privacy. Also the bad thing about this hotel is that if you complained to the staff about the lack of hygiene and wanting to change a room this is not possible and not because there are not enough rooms free (half of the hotel was empty) but because they did not want to, so we had a hard time with them too who were always unpolite and unfriendly. There was a lack of communication with the clients that it became pretty frightening in my view. Nothing more to add its pretty simple this is not the hotel we expected especially from a hotel called "COMFORT" that guaranteed comfort this was the last thing I expected.

Reviews.Title: “staff great location great room basic”
Reviews.Author: cosifantuttenz
Reviews.Content: the staff were really helpful, both reception and breakfast room were lovely.if they got new duvets would make an enormous difference to feeling of the room.....they were very old and worn.......location was great, handy to underground and train.it was great having jug in room and got biscuits daily nice touch . you really just wanted to sleep in room wasnt great to spend time in....had a really good shower. noise from fan in next doors bathroom was quite noisy in the room we had.fan noisy in our room too but at least cud turn off!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but don't expect much "comfort" at the Inn. Taxi to Holiday Inn please !”
Reviews.Author: kermit_the_blog
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is a short walk to and from the Eurostar terminal at St. Pancras. We booked a night either side of our journey to and from Disney Land Paris. Before booking we viewed the hotel website and found that it had been awarded four stars for B&B style accommodation from English Toursim. The pictures looked accepatable. However... We found the staff to be polite, friendly and helpful, but the hotel left a lot to be desired. The Reception area looked promising but as soon as you entered the communal stairways (narrow, cramped, stale) you were left wondering what the rooms would be like. Sadly, they were not much better. Although generally clean, you were left feeling you had camped the night in someone's neglected back bedroom. The rooms were small, noisy and in need of refurbishment. We stayed in a basement room one night (broken air con - and very stuffy) and in an attic room for the final night (air con worked but made strange electrical crackling noises so we turned it off). There were also various wires coming out the wall connected to a transformer which had been screwed to the bedroom wall. It turns out this was for the shower pump which screamed like a banshee when you turned it on. The buffet breakfast was in a windowless room in the basement. Basic offering with no expense spent on the catering. Crossiants had not seen the oven, being cold and hard. Ham looked very odd. Yoghurts were extremely cheap and nasty. However once again we found the staff to be helpful and efficient in seating us and dispensing toast. Stick to toast and a cup of tea (you make the tea yourself so should be reliable !). In summary, good staff, bad hotel, and for the price we paid the Holiday Inn and a taxi to the station would have been a better bet. Not four star by any standard.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we only stayed one night, happy that we rented apartment for a week.”
Reviews.Author: NhLunchlady
Reviews.Content: A lot of city noise if you open the window at night. Rooms were clean, smell of mold in bathroom. The breakfast room was very crowded and claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: ashmegs
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Comfort Inn at Kings Cross I enjoyed my stay. I'll break it down. 1. The Rooms. They were nice. They've been updated since a few of the pictures from reviewers were posted. Each room has a flat screen tv i'd say it was a 26 inchs. The rooms were not extremely large but ours was a pretty good size. 2. The Bathrooms. Very spacious. The shower was roomy and had recently been redone. Everything was very clean no mold or gunk. The water was always hot. 3. The Maids. Everyday our room was cleaned. She took out the garbage, made our beds and put out new towels. They say if you hang them up then they won't take them in order to save water but they did anyways. Oh Well it's always nice to have clean ones. They provide a dispincer full of soap and shampoo. 4. Every morning they provide breakfast. It's nice. They have ceral, cheese, toast (upon request), yogart and hard boiled eggs. To drink they have orange juice, apple juice, coffee, hot chocolate etc. My only complaint I like my milk cold for ceral and their was always warm. 5. Staff. I purchased 4 hours of internet and was told to sign on in would record the time without any other explaination. So I only used maybe 2 hours the next day I had none left. They forgot to explain you have to physicaly log off you cannot just shut down your computer. They gave me 2 free hours for the mis-understanding. I only had a problem with one guy who worked night shift. Our phone was cut off from making calls for two nights in a row he refused to cut it back on without charging my card that would later be returned but I spoke to another guy who said they wouldn't charge a holding fee just keep my number incase. We went around and around. Finally someone else from our group spoke to him and he agreed to cut in back on. Likes: Rooms are very clean! Staff was nice with the exception of the one late shift worker. Dislikes: No high-speed internet. They charge 20 pounds for 4 hours. They need free internet!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: swg
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was just okay. We were lucky enough to be given a suite as opposed to a normal size room so it was spacious. It was clean and did the job just for 1 night. The location is perfect for people wanting to access St Pancras and Kings Cross stations (1 minute walk). However, the breakfast room is extremely small for a hotel of that size. The self-service part of the breakfast is great and well organised. However, the breakfast staff have to 'manage' the toast and this is somewhat disorganised and at times hectic. Although the reception staff were very pleasant, I'm afraid this can't be said for a few of the breakfast staff! My main point to make about this hotel is that it in no way deserves a 4 star rating. I have stayed in many hotels and to be honest I have stayed in better 2 stars. On the website, they say it is a 'budget' hotel, but then give it a 4 star rating, which to me, doesn't match up.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough - will return”
Reviews.Author: CimaNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Kings Cross Comfort Inn. Having read a lot of bad reviews about the seedy budget hotels in London, we were very apprehensive about our stay especially since we were travelling with a toddler. But I would say that the stay was very pleasant. We booked one double room and a twin room (one for my husband, myself and my toddler and another for a visiting family friend) and both rooms were good. And just a hop, skip and jump to Kings Cross station. The carpet was a bit frayed, but that is expected. The beds were done well, though the blankets were very worn. The room was very neat and tidy and the shower room was good size and clean. There were lots of towels, crispy clean and white. Cant expect more in a five star hotel. The hand soap, shampoo and the shower jel smelled nice and felt like good quality stuff. The tea tray was adequate with some biscuits, which was perfect for our toddler. And lots of restuarants and coffee bars around, you will never be stranded for a choice. The breakfast room was very small and we had to go back to our room twice as there was no table available. Apart from that, the continental breakfast was adequate with lots of toast (you have to ask), juice, selection of cereals, selection of beverages, croissonts, buns, cold meat, yoghurt and eggs. The fruit was canned, though. The attitude of the staff right from the front desk to the service staff were excellant. When I asked someone at the front desk to warm some milk for my toddler, it was done immediately, with a smile. The front desk staff were also very polite and alert and knowledgable about the tourist destinations. Its as if they all love their jobs- I would give a special mention to the Philipina lady who was supervising the breakfast service - very polite and pleasant to deal with. On the negative side, the room was a bit noisy from the traffic outside and our room was overlooking a garage. With a double bed and a baby cot, there was barely any room to move. The washbasin was blocked. But these are some silly stuff we overlook, given that we are in London. Overall a good expereience for Â£125/night - we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant small hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaneHathaway
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed for 5 nights in the Comfort Inn King's Cross. The location is very convenient to the King's Cross Tube station and St Pancras International. We were within a two minute walk of the station, and as it is a major hub for several underground lines, this made traveling around the city a breeze. We left London via Eurostar for Paris, which departs from St Pancras, so this also worked out very conveniently. The hotel is in an older building, tucked around the block from the rail and underground stations. The staff is very pleasant and friendly. We were in a double room on the ground floor for the first three nights (the only room available), Internet rate of Â£90 per night, then moved to a twin room on the third floor for the remainder of our stay at the same rate. I experienced a bit of culture-shock over the high prices of hotels and everything else in London, but I believe the price tag was appropriate if not modest when I was looking for comparable properties in the area. The rooms were clean but small (again, this is apparently typical for all of moderately priced Western Europe hotels); the high-speed Internet access was pricey, considered how slowly it actually functioned. The room rate included continental breakfast with a large number of options (cereals, toast, boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, juices) the fresh croissants were quite good, the coffee was mediocre (made from a machine, not fresh brewed pots). I can't say enough, though, about the kindness and courtesy shown by the staff. My daughter and I were in and out of the hotel many times per day, they always greeted us, remembered our names, and could even inform me if my daughter had arrived or departed in my absence when she and I went on our separate forays around the city. While the area may seem a little sketchy after dark (after the crowds of tourists using the Tube stop and train station have dwindled away), during the day it felt quite safe. There are Internet cafes within easy walking distance, as well as a variety of restaurants and cafes ranging from Starbucks and Pret a Manger to attractive restaurants offering full service lunch and dinner meals.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: ashley97
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine, and a 3 minute walk from the station. Kings Cross is not the nicest of areas, but it was fine. Got a suite for L140 per night, the cheapest I could find in central London. But it was not worth $280 per night....for that I expected better. Room had a double bed with a separate living room with 2 chairs that pulled out into beds, fine for children but not adults. When the beds were pulled out, it was hard to manuever in the room. Small kitchenette area with a sink, small fridge and microwave and a bathroom with shower. Furniture was basic, staff was friendly. Walls are thin; I could hear when the guy in the next room took a shower or flushed the toilet. Free daily newspaper at reception. Bathroom was OK, everything else was OK. Internet connection for a fee....L3.50 for 30 minutes or L10 for 4 hours. Breakfast was in the basement....toast, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, breads and canned fruit.
