I've stayed in better, I've stayed in worse. This is not the Comfort Inn and Suites King's Cross...they are a few blocks over. Again, not bad, not great, cheapest I could find in London but for $280 a night, even in a huge city, I expected a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: flavioinocencio
Reviews.Content: I have made the reservation at the internet for a week. The staff was friendly but my room was tiny to say the least. No space whatsover. The hotel is okay only for one night or two, for additional nights I do not reccomend it. The hotel does not have a restaurant, the TV did not work well and after I complained about it, someone of the staff told me that was pidgeon's fault!, Moreover, because rooms are so close to each other you can actually listen to other people in the other rooms. The room was old and the bathroom ensuite was also old and not pristine in terms of cleaning. In my last night, I returned at two o' clock and the room was not cleaned yet, which shows the poor quality of service at the hotel. One of the reasons for people to choose another hotel, is that is possible with that amount of money I have spent to get a better deal. Therefore I do not believe it was good value for money and I do not advise people to stay unless for a night or two at the most..

Reviews.Title: “A place to spend a night...”
Reviews.Author: yankeeJersey
Reviews.Content: We booked 7 nights, for a suite. The best price for a suite that could fit 4 people. The room was on the first floor,we had to open 5 doors to get to the room. Tough to do when trying to manuever 4 pieces of luggage.The room was cramped for my wife and I and our two teenage daughters. The beds were uncomfortable and low. The noise level from outside was loud, old windows that need to be replaced. The shower was tight and we had trouble controling the temperture. We went to Paris on the Eurostar one day, very easy access from the hotel.There is an internet cafe around the corner,one pound per hour. Much cheaper than the hotel, which is 3.50 pound per half hour. Bottom line, the hotel is not the greatest, locaton for the tube and buses are very good. Bring plenty of money, food is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: 032611a
Reviews.Content: As someone who lives in Wolverhampton but works in Camden, I often stay at the Holiday Inn Regents Park (Book online early and its not so pricey), the Ibis Euston (Good sized rooms, rubbish beds) or the Thistle Euston (Average at everything). With no availability at my usual haunts, I thought I would try the Comfort Inn at Kings Cross, which at Â£102 including breakfast seemed pretty reasonable. I wasnâ€™t expecting luxury but to be fair my room, which was 116, was clean and tidy with a very comfortable bed. Room 116 is possessed of a few idiosyncrasies. The shower is interesting. The angled space-saver design means that the door hinges about a third of the way along its width. Consequently, unless you are a size zero model you have to press your back against the freezing cold tiles in order to close the door behind you. Also, the temperature control knob was for decoration only and the flow wouldnâ€™t take the froth off your latte. Sort of, donâ€™t feel the force Lukeâ€¦warm. Far and away the most interesting aspect of room 116 is that it is immediately off the ground floor Reception area. Yes thatâ€™s right, itâ€™s not on the first floor and itâ€™s not seven or eight rooms from the lift. The sash window opens onto the pavement and the bed is located so that the headboard is a stud wall thickness from Reception, which made for a very noisy stay. People coming and going in the early hours and doors banging from about 6am. This also means that the thunder-box is situated adjacent to Reception and the corridor to the rooms. You can overhear every word of conversation which I guess meansâ€¦well Iâ€™m sure you have it figured. The hotel staff were polite and helpful, tipping me off to a great Italian restaurant just around the corner (Cassa Mamma, Kings Cross), which was very busy but worth waiting for a table. In conclusion, this hotel does exactly what is says on the tin - cheap, clean budget accommodation a short walk from Kings Cross and Saint Pancras. Would I stay there again? Yes I probably will as long as they donâ€™t give me room 116!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located”
Reviews.Author: Milford46
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a short walk from Kings' Cross-St. Pancras. We traveled f rom Paris on Eurostar and did not find it difficult to roll our baggage to and from the hotel. The room we were assigned to was clean, the bed comfortable, and there was a nice teamaker set. However, the room was so tiny we could not find a place to put the suitcase and my spouse hit his head constantly on the wall mounted TV set. Our room was located on a very narrow, winding hallway with several stairs. If one has mobility problems, request a room accessable by lift. There is a lift, and in the lobby a big screen TV. There is a soda machine and an ice machine off the lobby. The continental breakfast included breads, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, butter, jam and some canned fruit. The desk clerks were courteous and efficient. There are lots of cheap eateries in the neighborhood. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: yazzuie
Reviews.Content: I spent a week holiday at the Confort Inn Kings Cross with my wife and teenaged daughter. Our room was a suite with a seperate bedroom, living room with pull out couch bed, and kitchenette. The room was plenty big enough for the three of us and we were quite comfortable. The couch bed was a bit hard but not terrible. The room was clean with fresh linens and towels. Wireless internet access was provided for a cost and login information obtained from the front desk. The staff was friendly and helpful. A basic self-serve breakfast was included. The only problem we had was the narrow stairs and corridores. My wife's leg was in a cast and she had a bit of trouble getting around. The location is very near Kings Cross Station which gives you transportation to practically everywhere (look for plateform 9 and three quarters while you're there). Around the block from the hotel are grocery stores and bit further is Starbucks. A Subway Sandwich shop is practically next door if you're desperate for close food.

Reviews.Title: “it's fine”
Reviews.Author: fiona229
Reviews.Content: Stayedhere overnight prior to a meeting. The meeting organisers allowed a budget of Â£100 per night which doesn't get you much in central London. The room was fairly small but very clean. The bathroom was spotless. Breakfast is croissants, bread rolls cheese etc. It is not aluxury hotel but I felt it was good value for teh money. As it's close to King's cross station it is very central and convenient for sight seeing. The staff were very friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: TchrMeg
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week-long stay at the Comfort Inn Kings Cross in London, England, UK. Though the room was small, it was perfect for a person who just needed a place to sleep and rest before exploring the city of London. It is set off of the main roads, so the room was quiet throughout the day. The hotel is situated within 2 blocks of busy Kings Cross station where you can get several tube lines or an international train. A wonderful arrangement for someone who is depending on using the underground system to get around the city. Every morning, there was a continental breakfast provided by the hotel. Not super fancy, but just right for a traveler - bread, cheese, cereal, juice, yogurt, cold meats, and hot drinks. The reception desk employees were friendly and extremely helpful. Every time I had a question, they were willing to answer or help me find the answer however possible. I would most certainly stay at this Comfort Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: catJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night prior catching the Eurostar to Paris Disney, it is just across the road from St Pancreas, the room was very clean and adequate for our stay, it was small but had enough room to move around in without bumping into anything, staff were very helpful, and the breakfast next morning was OK and kept us going till late afternoon, the beauty of continental is that you can help yourself to enough to fill you up. We would say again next time we travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “catch the mouse!”
Reviews.Author: laskucc
Reviews.Content: I WAS 19 YEARS OLD, I and my boyfriend booked a double room at commfort inn just for 2 night and then we want to reach ireland. Unfortunately my boyfriend got sick, so we continued our terrible staying at comfort inn for 5 nights. They said us that to continue our stay we have to change room, so gave us a terrible room at low ground with a windows at level of the bottom of the buiding, just on pipes and kitchen extractor, closed on the sides from the wall of the buiding, where we saw a big mouse. I told what we saw at reception and they laugh of us and said me that I have to catch the mouse. The room was very hot, and was impossible to sleep with close window. I WAS DESPAIRED, I ask they to call a doctor for my boyfriend becuse he got worse. They send me a doctor and I paid him 100 pounds when they said me that I would pay at most 60 pounds. I praid the receptionist to change our room, but they laugh at me always(I think because I seem very young). Finally, hopeless, I call the airlines and I booked a return flight. Never I've been so happy to be at home. Comfort Inn King's Cross, the worst! P.S. sorry for my bad english!

Reviews.Title: “Cold Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Leoandjack
Reviews.Content: Stopped here one night only, thank goodness. Paid over Â£100 for a room advertised as a double but on entering room realised there was only about 1/2 m clearance each side to the walls. The building from the outside has a Georgian look but as you enter the building all evidence of a former Georgian building is completely absent. The staircases were all very narrow and I'd hate to be here if the fire alarm went of, thankfully all the fire doors closed well. Breakfast was continental i.e floppy cold toast, usual jams, poor quality meats, yogurts and a selection of hard boiled eggs! Staff were generally non communicative, I suspect they wouldn't go the extra inch never extra mile. Would defintiely not be going back

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: BertieUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, after reading some of the reviews we were a little apprehensive, but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Reception was spotlessly clean and we were greeted by an extremely pleasant member of staff and showed to our room, the room was quite large (bigger than we expected) it was clean and very comfortable, the bedding and towels were spotless, although it was basic it suited our needs perfectly and of course the price was reasonable too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a decent budget hotel, and its within walking distance of Kings Cross/St Pancreas underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Book a Dungon Room at the Comfort Inn, Kings Cross!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTownTraveler
Reviews.Content: Be forewarned â€“ our rooms at the Comfort Inn, Kings Cross were so ridiculously retched that after a couple nights, we referred to them as our Dungeon! The front desk staff was dismissive and disorganized. They insisted on seeing my credit card three times, so I am now closely monitoring my bill. The euphemistically named "lower first floor" room is actually the basement. My son's room overlooked a filthy, trashed-filled alley, my complaints about which were shrugged-off by the rude and indifferent staff. The window in my husbandâ€™s and my room was level with the sidewalk, offering pedestrians a direct view of our bed. Needless to say, it was also noisy, and there was little privacy. The magnetic-credit-card-style room keys only worked about half the time, so we were continually climbing the stairs to wait at the front desk to get them reprogrammed. When I asked for a second backup key, I was denied. Though well-located for the price, The Comfort Inn, Kings Cross must survive on the unsuspecting London traveler, who is their mercy once they check-in. The staff and rooms certainly would not bring repeat guests. Consider yourself forewarned!

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: yvonnedanger
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find a nice but cheap hotel in London. This town is really expensive. Hotels usually aren't the cleanest and have the smallest rooms and hallways. My room was small too. After entering I stood right next to the bed. The cover was 70s style but everything was clean. The bathroom was small and clean too, but that didn't bother me. I only stayed in my room for sleeping. There was also a safe in the room, a tea maker, tea bags and instant coffee, and a small tv on top of the wardrobe. I was on the third floor, right next to the elevator which made me think it would be loud but that wasn't the case. Frankly I only got back to my room at 2 am, but even in the morning I only heard people entering the elevator once. There was also no traffic noise, even tho the hotel is only a 3 minute walk from the King's Cross / St. Pancras stations. The hotel is located conveniently with the tube and trains nearby and there are also a lot of opportunities for eating on the way. Subway, McDonald's and Burger King for fast food lovers but I also walked past a place that serves Indian dishes and I went to Casa Mamma a couple of times. The prices there are average, the people there are nice and the meals are good, although I don't recommend ordering lasagne (I got the smallest lasagne I have ever seen it my life); pizzas are good sizes tho. I also found all of the reception staff to be very friendly, I don't understand what the other people who wrote reviews are talking about. For a good price I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: steph81884
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Comfort Inn Kings Cross in July. It's not the fanciest hotel and the rooms are a bit small but clean and it is a decent deal for a budget traveler. One thing my friend and I found interesting was that our bathroom was actually the same size or bigger than our hotel room. The staff are nice and helped us book a tour to Stonehenge. It's close to the Kings Cross metro station and has a Subway around the corner if you want an inexpensive meal. The breakfast isn't anything to write home about but isn't too bad- with cereal and fruit from a can and hardboiled eggs and toast (you have to special order the toast). I would recommend this hotel for people who are just looking for a place to sleep and are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Look around before you book the Comfort Inn King's Cross”
Reviews.Author: dler
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying for the four nights we had planned, but almost didn't. The room they initially gave our family of four us was very small and very shabby, but that isnâ€™t primarily what made us ask for a different room. The smell of mildew/mold was overpowering. It was strong in the hallways, and worse in the room. We usually wouldnâ€™t request a different room, but as I told the desk clerk, this was the most expensive room I had ever stayed in (due to London prices and the exchange rate), and it shouldnâ€™t be the worst. He was helpful, and found a suite that he gave us for the same price. This second room wasnâ€™t luxurious, but it was clean and smelled fine (both inside and in the hallway). There was only one small (9 inch? 12 inch?) TV, and the living room area bed was basically an old fold out couch, not a hide-a-bed. The linens were worn, poor quality, and non matching, but they were clean. The included breakfasts were not fancy, but filling. The staff was nice, especially the breakfast lady. Both of the rooms we were in were in the basement, but on different sides of the building. I wonder if there are drainage issues on the right side. Location was fine--restaurants and pubs to walk to, different forms of public transportation not too far away. Overall, London was easier to get around than I expected. The immediate area was not touristy, but seemed safe and relatively quiet. I would stay at this hotel again, but would try elsewhere first. I think a hotel owner should think of their business as they would a home: Would I give these accommodations to a friend? Our second room was three star quality, but I would never think of letting a friend (or even my friendâ€™s dog) stay in the first room. We had made reservations at full price well in advance--that room should only be used as last resort-- if at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible receptionist, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Wendyfifi
Reviews.Content: I arrived midnite and was given a room close to the main road. It was so noisy that I couldn't sleep at all. I have very gd noise tolerence level given that I came fr Hong Kong! When I asked receptionist Zhuro politely if it was possible to change room. She gave me a stern look and said nobody ever complained that room and only the room nxt to it is available. Later on, I discovered that a glass panel of my room's window was broken. When I informed her, she gave me the look that I was such an annoying customer. She also said the cleaner had left and it wasn't possible to change room....... They advertised that they got the award of the best comfort inn in the UK... just show you how bad the other ones might be...... Much prefer Harlingford Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: LPP
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Gatwick Airport & took the First Capital Connect Train to Kings Cross Thameslink station. From there the hotel is only a two minute walk that was no problem pulling our luggage. Very convenient for the buses to anywhere plus the tube is right there. Our room #139 was very clean & the bathroom was actually much bigger than I expected. The room was small but very clean & the maid made it up everyday & always had lots of fresh towels. There was a kettle with packets of tea & coffee & cookies every day. The breakfast was quite good & I was suprised at how good the coffee selection was for breakfast. The airconditioning worked great & was a welcome relief on the hot days. Also the hotel has an elevator. It is a bit off the main road so that made it a little more quiet & we were not disturbed at night by noise. The staff was very helpful & courteous. All & all a good stay & I would go back there again. Not to be confused with the Comfort Inn Kings Cross Suites on Argyle. This is the one on St Chad's Street of of Euston.

Reviews.Title: “well impressed”
Reviews.Author: dinkyninky
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a number of budget hotels in London before, and generally they are grotty. This, however, was a pleasant surprise. The staff were courteous and friendly. The room was absolutely tiny, with not much room for storage. I only had a small weekend-sizes bag of stuff, which was ok, but if you had a big case or rucksack, ir if you were staying for more than 4 or 5 days, you might find it too cramped. there was a tiny little bathroom too. I'm not being funny, but if you were fat you wouldn't have made it in or out. there was about a foot between the hand basin and the wall, and you had to squeeze past to reach the shower. nevertheless, it was spotless. and since it was so small, my face was pretty close to the wall at all times, and it GLEAMED. There was tea facilities, a hairdryer, tv and so on in the room. The bed sheets were clean and smelled like laundry powder - infinitely preferable to some places I've stayed. I think there was asn incontinence sheet under the bed sheet tho - not sure about this but there was a distinct rustle when I got in. all the better I suppose... there was a gradn little window in the room which could be opened - often there isn't, you know - so plenty of fresh air. the location is great, just around the corner from Kings Cross station, which is a major transport hub for buses, undergrounds, national rail, and soon the eurostar train. there wasn't a huge selection fo eateries in the area - a decent enough italian (cheap and cheerful) called Casa Mamma, a few dodgy Indians. there's a Pret dwn past the train station on Kings Cross Road, always good for breakfast/lunch. breakfast in the hotel wasn't up to much. some odd-tasting croissants (i think they had been frozen. tasted a bit stale), a coffee vending machine, a juice machine, a load of hard boiled eggs. toast on demand. not worth getting up for, but but would fill a hole for a couple of hours. Overall a grand spot, reasonable, good value for money, good location, spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tonyrosenalex
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel over the net but as we needed a room big enough for 4 adults we contacted the hotel direct and the staff were very helpful. On arrival we had been upgraded to a suite not sure how big a normal room is as the suite wasnt massive but the room was clean if a little dated there was even a kitchenette with microwave and fridge. The bathroom was modern and clean when we asked for more towels reception staff responded immediately. The continental breakfast was great plenty of everything. Overall we had a great night in London and the hotel really was adequte for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not much for the money”
Reviews.Author: PatReynolds
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the hotel overnight on the 24th February. The check in was fine - a very friendly chap on reception. Our room was very small, in fact, the smallest 'double room' we have ever stayed in. We did ask if there was a larger room, but were told the hotel was full. (a room number had been written on our keycard envelope, and then crossed out, leaving me to wonder if another guest had asked for a larger room, after seeing the size of this one) The view from our window was over a small covered courtyard, which made me feel very claustrophobic, and any longer that one night, would have caused me trouble. However the bed was very comfortable, although the T.V. was perched on top of the wardrobe (Hmmm) The bathroom was clean. The room was quiet, so we got a good nights sleep. The breakfast was O.K., although I think if all the guests arrived at once there would have been a squash (there was a bit of table-sharing as it was) There wasn't any communal areas, such as a lounge or small bar. There was the small foyer, which was in the process of being refurbished, and a vending machine. The hotel was in a convenient location for the tube etc... I thought that Â£95 for a double room in this hotel was pricey. I have paid round this price before in London, and got better value. I would stay there again if I could guarantee a larger room. If my husband and myself were fatties, we might have got wedged in room this size.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: nordicatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights with our two young children. The room was not huge or luxurious, but it was clean and suited our needs just fine. Most importantly, it was cheaper than similar options for a family. The breakfast was a good start to the day and the location is excellent. The staff were friendly and kind. I think the hotel website offered a good deal if you can plan in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Value”
Reviews.Author: Mineola
Reviews.Content: Best find in London. Clean, nice size rooms with new bathrooms, elevator (lift) and the most helpful staff. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left the staff was attentive to all our needs. If your a family on a budget there are plenty of reasonable places to eat nearby including McDonalds, Burger King and Subways. The free deluxe continental breakfast including eggs, cheese and croissants as well as yogurt and cereal was filling enough to carry you to an early dinner. It's located by major tube lines and bus connections. The British Library is within walking distance. It contains treasures ranging from the Magna Carta to The Beatle's handwritten lyrics. The British museum is just a 15 minute walk or 3 bus stops away. Both are good places to start you sightseeing if your room is not ready for check in. If you plan on staying here, call the hotel to arrange a car service for you from the airport. They can save you quite a bit of money.

Reviews.Title: “I Would NOT Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: rwc27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a state of disrepair and the service is below average. It is budget for London (90 pounds/night) but it did not deliver on the money spent. Construction in the lobby floor had the linoleum tiles pulled up and chicken wire exposed and lifted up off the floor almost 12 inches right in the walkway. My wife didn't see the chicken wire and tripped over it almost falling on her face. I understand that repairs have to be made but they must cover them off hours and have clear signs and paths for the safety of guests to navigate through them. Room was extremely small and tired, bed small and lumpy, 70's decor. The whole feel of the hallways, stairs and carpets is confined and old/wore out. Tiny bathroom, I'm skinny and 5 11' yet my knees touched the sink when I sat on the loo. If I was a 250 pounder my gut would touch the sink. B-fast was fine, nothing special and when we asked for ice cubes in our drinks the lady worker said gruffly "Go to reception". It wasn't busy that morning for b-fast as we and one other gent we're there and she could have accomodated us on this request. This is more hostel than hotel and at 90 pounds/180$ US I felt ripped off. Will defeinately not stay here again. There are better "Budget Hotels " around this area like Travel Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible (see attached photos)”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0987654321
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited many destinations, both within the U.S and in Europe. This is by far the worst hotel we have ever stayed at in. By far... Well, let the pictures speak for themselves. This is what happened: Stayed in this hotel in October 2006. We were originally placed in one of the basement rooms. It was very humid. Mold was all over the bathroom ceiling. Once you used a towel, it would remain wet. We were told the hotel was booked solid, so there was no opportunity to switch rooms at that time. A middle-aged couple next door smoked like chimneys and kept their door open for ventilation. Even with our door closed the room constantly smelled of cigarette smoke. That, however, was a blessing in disguise, as we later learned. Our neighbors left the next day, and the smoke cleared. After we stepped into our room that evening, it smelled like something died in it. As it turned out, it was the smell of mold. We just couldn't feel it the night before because of all the cigarette smoke. And it grew considerably too. We had no idea mold would actually smell so rancid, nor did we know it could grow that fast. We also noticed various grey and brownish stains on some of the new towels left by housekeeping earlier that day. But - by comparison - that was the least of our concerns at that point. We needed to get out of "the dungeon". Eventually we were able to move into a different room (on the ground floor). The picture of a filthy faucet is from that second room. And the pillow too. Really, there were a lot more photo opportunities of the same kind in this place. We weren't rude when pointing out all of these things to the hotel staff. And the staff weren't rude either. They just don't care. When I asked them about the mold in our first room, the exact reply was "Oh yeah. We were just waiting for you guys to leave so that we could clean it up." When I mentioned the dirty towels and sheets, this is what they told me: "Our laundry is done off-site, by another company. This is what it looks like when they send it back to us. There nothing we can do about it." Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on 30th/31st December for New Year. We found the room to be very small, but very clean and well worth the money we paid. We just wanted a cheap base to explore London and this is what we got. The breakfast was an added bonus, as most hotels around this price range did not include breakfast. It was well worth getting up for in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for a cheap place to stay that is clean and friendly. The lady who managed the breakfast in the morning was extremely friendly and helpful, even though it was very busy when we stayed and she must have been very stressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ecd916
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent; just a 2-3 minute walk from Kings Cross / St Pancras tube station. The room was reasonably clean; bathroom was very clean, though the fixtures needed some minor maintenance. Shower was great - hot with a good volume of water. Room had hair dryer, kettle, mugs, tea, coffee, little cream cookies. My husband's only complaint was a lack of a pub in the immediate area. We got up too late to sample breakfast, but there were plenty of coffee shops in the area. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “it was terrible”
Reviews.Author: natnat1976
Reviews.Content: we stayed on monday the 6th november when we checked in the evening the man on reception was so rude, we requested a non smoking room but where given a smoking room that smelt very bad. When we asked to change rooms he said none were available and he could not do anything about it. The following morning he was in reception again to my horror he asked me if i enjoyed my stay when he knew very well i didnt. He then said it was unfortunate and i told him i wouldnt come here again and he was very pleased with it and said good. dont go there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Choice”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1704
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on Saturday 28 October 2006 in a double room. We obtained a good rate by booking directly with the hotel website in advance. We arrived about 30 minutes before the check in time and were invited to sit in the receiption area while they checked our room. After about a five minute wait we were able to go to our room. The room was in the basement but had a window facing an inner courtyard. The room was small (average for London) had everything that one required. There was an ensuit shower room. The room was very clean, comfortable and the decor was fine apart from some of the wall paper was slightly peeling off at the edges but nothing major. Breakfast was continential and self service. We were impressed with the variety for a budget hotel. We were able to leave our case at the hotel until it was time to depart London. Overall we had a very pleasant stay, the room was great value and service was very good. We would stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: HelenDavis84
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel for a weekend down in London. It was very close to both Kings Cross (and the tube) and Euston station. The staff were very friendly. Breakfast was good considering it was included in the price. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel compared to some I've stayed in for a higher price in London.

Reviews.Title: “A roof over my head for the night”
Reviews.Author: sonofagunn
Reviews.Content: I was quite pleased with the Comfort Inn in Kings Cross. Admittedly, I was upgraded to a family room from a twin which was more than ample for me on my own. I ended up staying at the Comfort Inn because it seemed, from the reviews on tripadvisor, the best compromise between price and quality. (All the other decent hotels in Bloomsbury were fully booked for some reason). The room was clean, the usual tea and coffee making facilities were present and the air-con was silent albeit either on or off (you couldn't adjust it) The staff were very friendly and helpful which is always a pleasant surprise in London hotels! I wouldn't hesitate to stop here again, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: alco
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel twice in a 2 week period and was pleasantly surprised, the hotel staff were most pleasant to deal with, something that other hotels in London seem to lack, the rooms were small, but very comfortable and well appointed for a budget motel, taking into account the great attitude of the staff and the price, and room appointments, this is the best value for money Hotel I've found in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: ILiketoTravel01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in London before. We were familiar with the area and felt comfortable choosing this location. The room was not as expected from the pictures posted. Our room had mold spots on the wall. The bed does not sit on a bed frame. It is a box spring and mattress on the ground. The bathroom does have some space to put your stuff away. In our room the shower door had a broken wheel and had problems staying on track. There were no dressers in the room. It had a place to hang some clothes, but is not a closet with a door. We did ask for a different room but none were available. No discount was given. It does have a tv with cable in the room but is only a 14" screen.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, but...”
Reviews.Author: luvimorga
Reviews.Content: Good : location (close to Kings Cross / St. Pancras tube and railway stations), helpful staff, clean room, good shower, many cheap restaurants around if youÂ´re in a hurry, great price (for London). Not so good : the room is minuscule, youÂ´ll have to put your suitcase on the bed to open it . The nearby police station means sirens wailing through the night. Air conditioning is installed so that the cold air draught goes straight to your head when lying in bed (yes, IÂ´ve tried to re-direct the vanes, didnÂ´t work). On the other hand keeping the window open will bring you the smell of all those nearby food joints, at least if you stay in the third (top) floor. The usual quirky electrical installation, and the steps in the corridor will make lugging the suitcase around a nice workout. Overall this is a good choice if youÂ´re on a budget, and access to transportation is excellent, but IÂ´ll probably try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: Jokke
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort Inn Kings Cross 3 nights from 10. June. 4 minutes walking to Kings Cross. For a scandinavian was the breakfast not so good "only" bread, cereal, juice, coffee, tea and hot chocolate, plus canned peaches, cheese and hard boiled eggs. Friendly staff and quick service. Small but fine rooms. Vendings whith soft drinks and candy, ice maker. Near Kings Cross but not noisy

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FerdaKoksoy
Reviews.Content: We (family-teenager) booked this accommodation based on the reviews of â€œTripadvisorâ€� and by â€œExpediaâ€�. It was clean, noiseless and comfortable. The location was 20 minutes walk into the heart of old town. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Everything was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but good”
Reviews.Author: plaidbagel
Reviews.Content: It was a great location, just a block from King's Cross station where there were 5 tube lines and a block from First Connect Thameslink which took us directly to and from Gatwick airport in about 1 hour. The hotel staff was friendly and helped set up a taxi for us the morning we needed to be at the train station early to head with a tour group to Paris for a day (worth the time to take the trip through the chunnel). Every morning they had a nice breakfast with bread, cereal, juice, coffee, tea and hot chocolate, plus canned peaches, cheese and hard boiled eggs. Enough to fill our stomachs before all the walking we did. The rooms were small and the beds a little firm, but the bathrooms were nice and new. Air conditioning was great and there was an elevator and ice machine. They even let us check in early. The only bummer was that I had another friend visiting London and she left a message for me at the front desk so we could meet up while we were both there, but I never got the message. I would recommend the hotel though for it's location and what you get for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Comfort Inn Kings Cross 3 nights from 9. June and had a very pleasant stay. The location is good, giving easy access to most of London. Rooms are small, but work out great for tourists only stopping by for a shower and a few hours sleep. The included breakfast was not exactly exciting stuff, but probably saved us quite a bit of time and money. For three nights we payed 420Â£ for two twinrooms, felt we got a very good value for our money. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother, niece, daughter, and I spent 8 nights at the Kings Cross Comfort Inn and were very pleased. We had two rooms, each non-smoking and with two twin beds. The rooms were very clean. Our sheets were changed at least twice, maybe three times, while we were there. The bathrooms were a nice size and also very clean. The included breakfast included croissants, yogurt, cheese, cereal, toast, boiled eggs, juice, and a selection of coffees and hot chocolate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived at the hotel at 11am hoping to be able to deposit our luggage, and we were actually able to check into one of our rooms immediately. As we were heading out the door, less than 30 minutes later, our other room was also ready. The rooms were conveniently located across the hall from each other and separated from the stairs and the rest of the hall by a fire door, so we had a great deal of privacy. We did not spend a great deal of time in our rooms, so did not suffer from the limited selection of television channels. The location was fantastic -- just a couple of blocks from the Thameslink station and from the Kings Cross tube and train stations. We bought London Passes with travelcards before we left and picked them up at the British Visitors Center in Picadilly the first day we arrived. We had them validated to begin the next day. We visited many sights with our passes and enjoyed a couple of theater productions. Everything was easily accessible from Kings Cross. We even traveled to Chislehurst, Eltham, Greenwich, and Hampton Court with ease using our travelcards to catch the trains. My only complaints were the mattress pad on my bed which was falling apart and not very smooth and the noisy neighbors we had above us for a few nights. Other than that, and a bit of cold rainy weather, our trip could not have been better.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Kings Cross
HotelInfo.Address: 2-5 St Chad's Street, London WCIH 8BD, England
